title: Search stops at first occurence of a word even if there is an exact match
author: farosch
body_snippet:
![2017-10-31 14_51_53-sdkesx siedle local vmware esxi](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22905106/32269470-c511ef80-bef2-11e7-8b0b-e4bbd5366ced.png)
When searching through connections the first item that contains the search string gets selected, even if there is an exact match to the search string.
The search algorithm should at first always try to find an exact match. Only if this fails should it search for a connection just containing the search string.

comments.snippet: Current search implementation is not very robust. Reference #205 & #696
comments.author: kmscode

comments.snippet:
I would like to have the option to filter the list. If you have many connections in your list the current search implementations isn't very clearly.
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1539498/44451016-c7f21580-a5f2-11e8-893a-edb49e028824.png)
Filtered it could look like this.
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1539498/44451069-e9530180-a5f2-11e8-8996-ce7f89f8eded.png)
comments.author: proxymus

comments.snippet: @proxymus v1.76.x has search filtering as a new feature
comments.author: sparerd

comments.snippet: Triage refresh (P2): this issue has been inactive for a long time. Please retest on the latest build and share reproducible steps, expected vs actual behavior, and logs/screenshots. If there is no confirmation/update, maintainers can close it as stale or not reproducible.
comments.author: robertpopa22
